revised_title: Inquiry into the Cause of Voluntary Muscular Motion
tldr: The author, Charles Morton, investigates the cause of voluntary muscular motion through a philosophical analysis. He observes the structure and use of muscles, the role of blood vessels and nerves, and the difference between voluntary and involuntary motion. He concludes that the will has a direct power to heighten and increase the sensation of nerves, which leads to muscle contraction.
